intro: Ephielis guianensis, commonly known as the Guianese sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wetland environments, such as marshes and swampy areas, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils. Ephielis guianensis has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences that are characteristic of the sedge family. It plays an important ecological role in its habitat by providing shelter and food for various wildlife species.
